job_title: Anonymous Employee in Des Moines, IA
pros: Worked with some great doctors. Has improved the looks of the hospital since I started In 1999, this greatly improved their image.  The equipment upgrades were slow coming but were a great plus.
cons: In their effort to save money they hired a shyster. This man had employees that had worked together for close to 20 years turning against each other.  He would tell one employee that the other said something bad about them.  I got him figured out he was trying to get a reason to fire the people with longevity so he could hire new people at a lower rate of pay. He went as far as lying about a persons medical  condition to force them into leaving.  I would not work for the company when they would go so low as to hire such a rotten person.

job_title: Case Manager in Altoona, IA
pros: IPERS, that's about it. I met some good friends there.
cons: I worked there for over 6 years, the job was very stressful and demanding. I witnessed a lot of great long term employees leave, and this was mainly due to the poor leadership there. It's sad that it could be a great place to work but upper leadership turns a blind eye to management and how they run things. I left and I really don't think anyone could have cared less, pretty sorry I worked so hard and wasted so much time there. Oh and I can't wait until the department of labor finds out that they adjust your time so you never really get paid fairly for all the work you do.

review_title: It is a fabulous place to work!
job_title: Registered Nurse in Des Moines, IA
pros: It is a family atmosphere. Everyone works together as a team. Awesome support from leaders. Open door policies by administration. The patients are culturally diverse and gives us a great variety of challenges which leads to strenghtening of our nursing skills.  Our patients are the best!
cons: I have worked at broadlawns medical center for a long time and am hard pressed to find a lot of negatives about the place. In my opinion broadlawns is the best kept secret for nursing employees in town. If you want a great place to work come to broadlawns. You will be pleasantly surprised.

job_title: Patient Support Attendant: Patient Care Technician in Des Moines, IA
pros: Broadlawns Medical Center is a great Hospital that I would recommend for anyone to work at.  I enjoyed the time working with all these amazing people.
cons: There are a lot of work to do there, so I think the employees should get a raise, especially people who been there for a while and, yet still receive the same payment as the new ones.   At least that was my personal experience as a patient Support attendance or aid technician

review_title: I enjoy my experience at Broadlawns
